FacilityName: Saputo Dairy Foods USA, LLC - Delhi
FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_prev_prog_3.Description: The Saputo Dairy Foods -Delhi plant follows the 14 elements of the OSHA Process Safety Management Program as a release prevention program for RMP.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION & EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



Saputo is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is inherent to a comprehensive accidental release prevention program in place that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the processes at our facility. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.  If such a release does occur, our employees are trained to follow the Emergency Action Plan and to evacuate the facility as necessary. We are also coordinated with the Delhi, Emergency Management / LEPC which provides additional emergency response expertise.



FACILITY INFORMATION & REGULATED SUBSTANCES



The Saputo Dairy Foods USA, LLC - Delhi facility is located at 40236 State Highway 10, Delhi, NY 13753. The plant's primary function is to manufacture milk products and store the products until it can be distributed to stores, restaurants and other customers. The facility employs approximately 212 full-time employees. There is one RMP-regulated substance, anhydrous ammonia, used in the plant's refrigeration system to provide refrigeration for processing and cold storage of dairy food products. This system contains 18,838 lbs. of anhydrous ammonia.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM & CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



The Saputo Dairy Foods - Delhi plant follows the 14 elements of the OSHA Process Safety Management program as a release prevention program for RMP. In addition, Saputo Corporate - Department of Refrigeration Services works with the plant confirming regulatory and corporate standards are being followed, providing guidance and standardization on the RMP and OSHA PSM programs and acting as a resource for the plant on the RMP, PSM and other environmental programs.



THE FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



Saputo Dairy Foods - Delhi has had a good record of pre

venting accidental releases over the last five years.  Due to our release prevention policies, no incidents, as defined by the RMP rule, have occurred in the past five years.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



Saputo Dairy Foods - Delhi has developed an Emergency Action Plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials as well as other emergency events that might occur at the plant. The purpose of Saputo's Emergency Action Plan is to ensure employees know and understand what to do in the event of an emergency in order to minimize injuries and property damage. The plan includes various aspects of an emergency including adequate first aid, evacuations, and notification of local emergency response agencies. Specific employees are trained and certified as medical responders. All employees are trained in evacuation, hazard communication, and chemical safety. In addition, the plan is promptly updated to reflect pertinent changes.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Several developments and findings have resulted from the implementation of the various elements of our accidental release prevention program. Recommendations resulting from the PHA, compliance audits and mechanical integrity inspections will be addressed in a timely manner. In addition, regular interaction with Saputo Corporate - Department of Refrigeration Services, Health & Safety, Environmental and Risk Group will improve compliance and overall plant safety.
